Dogecoin Open Interest ดิ่งลงสู่ระดับตุลาคม 2024 ก่อนการ Pump

Dogecoin Open Interest Crashes To October 2024 Levels Before The Pump

13h ago//Scott Matherson
altcoins
AI

Summary

TH

Open Interest ของ Dogecoin ได้ตกลงไปต่ำกว่า 1 พันล้านดอลลาร์ ซึ่งเป็นระดับที่ไม่เคยปรากฏมาตั้งแต่เดือนตุลาคม 2024 ในอดีต การตกลงของ Open Interest ครั้งนั้นได้นำไปสู่การราคาพุ่งขึ้นอย่างมหาศาลที่ทำให้ DOGE พุ่งจาก 0.155 ดอลลาร์ไปจนถึง 0.46 ดอลลาร์ แม้ว่านักเทรดบางส่วนจะคาดการณ์ว่าประวัติศาสตร์อาจซ้ำรอย แต่ภาวะเศรษฐกิจมหภาคในปัจจุบันแตกต่างออกไปเนื่องจากท่าที hawkish ของ Federal Reserve แม้ว่าการสนับสนุนจาก Elon Musk จะยังคงส่งผลต่อความรู้สึกของตลาดอยู่ แม้ว่า Open Interest จะลดลง แต่กิจกรรมการซื้อขายในตลาดยังคงสูงโดย Derivatives trading volume ได้พุ่งขึ้นมากกว่า 100% สู่ถึง 6.5 พันล้านดอลลาร์ การคาดการณ์ของนักวิเคราะห์แตกต่างกันไป โดย Ali Martinez บ่งชี้ว่าราคาอาจจะดิ่งลงไปที่ 0.054 ดอลลาร์ ในขณะที่ Mikybull Crypto ชี้ให้เห็นว่า RSI ในปัจจุบันบ่งชี้ถึงการเด้งกลับขึ้นได้ ขณะนี้ Dogecoin มีราคาอยู่ที่ประมาณ 0.09075 ดอลลาร์ พร้อมกับความรู้สึกของนักเทรดที่แตกต่างกันไปในแต่ละตลาดซื้อขาย

EN

Dogecoin’s open interest has crashed below $1 billion, reaching levels not seen since October 2024. This previous drop in open interest historically preceded a significant price rally that saw DOGE surge from $0.155 to $0.46. While some traders speculate that history could repeat itself, the current macroeconomic environment differs due to the Federal Reserve's hawkish stance, though support from Elon Musk continues to influence sentiment. Despite the drop in open interest, market activity remains high as derivatives trading volume has surged by over 100% to $6.5 billion. Analyst predictions vary, with Ali Martinez suggesting a potential fall to $0.054, while Mikybull Crypto points to the RSI indicating a possible bounce. Currently, Dogecoin is trading around $0.09075, with mixed trader sentiment across different exchanges.

Key Points

  • Dogecoin open interest has dropped to October 2024 levels, below $1 billion.
  • Historically, a similar drop preceded a major price surge to $0.46.
  • Analysts are divided on price direction, with targets ranging from $0.054 to a bullish rebound.
  • Derivatives trading volume surged by over 100%, indicating high trader activity.
  • Market sentiment is mixed, with Binance traders mostly long while the broader market remains bearish.

Article

Trusted Editorial content, reviewed by leading industry experts and seasoned editors. Ad Disclosure Dogecoin’s open interest has crashed to levels not seen since October 2024. This was notably just before the leading meme coin recorded a significant surge, raising speculation that history might repeat itself. Dogecoin’s open interest has crashed below $1 billion, down over 16%, according to Coinglass data . The last time the open interest dropped to these levels was in October 2024, just before it began an uptrend which led to a high of $4.45 billion in December 2024. October 2024 also marked the bottom for the DOGE price , as it rose from around $0.155 to as high as $0.46. Dogecoin notably rose back then, partly thanks to Donald Trump’s presidential election victory and Elon Musk’s move to name a government agency, the Department of Government Efficiency, after DOGE. Additionally, the Fed lowered rates at the time, which was also bullish for the leading meme coin. Source: Chart from Coinglass It remains to be seen whether Dogecoin can replicate such a price surge this time, given that open interest has dropped to October 2024 levels. It is also worth noting that the current macroeconomic outlook differs this time, with the Fed making a hawkish pivot and unlikely to lower rates until at least June. However, Musk recently mentioned Dogecoin , saying they could send the meme coin to the moon next year. Meanwhile, crypto traders on Binance look to be positioning for a price surge in hopes that this might be the bottom for Dogecoin. The current long/short ratio is 2, indicating that most traders are long. However, DOGE’s long/short ratio across all exchanges is still below 1, indicating that most crypto traders are still bearish and shorting the meme coin. DOGE Still Risks Dropping To $0.054 Crypto analyst Ali Martinez has indicated that Dogecoin could still drop to as low as $0.054. In an X post , he stated that this is the level he is looking at for a potential bounce. However, crypto analyst Mikybull Crypto suggested that the leading meme coin may not drop to that level, as DOGE’s RSI is currently at a historical level that has acted as support in past cycles. As such, there is the possibility that it could bounce from here. It is worth noting that Dogecoin has seen a surge in metrics, including derivatives trading volume , which has increased by more than 100% to $6.5 billion. Options trading volume and open interest have also surged by 381% and 135%, respectively, indicating that crypto traders are actively trading the meme coin. At the time of writing, the Dogecoin price is trading at around $0.09075, down over 11% in the last 24 hours, according to data from CoinMarketCap.
